lore.title: The Lore Schema
examples: Innately connected to the latent power of Runeterra, Ahri is a vastaya who can reshape magic into orbs of raw energy. She revels in toying with her prey by manipulating their emotions before devouring their life essence. Despite her predatory nature, Ahri retains a sense of empathy as she receives flashes of memory from each soul she consumes.

blurb.title: The Blurb Schema
examples: Innately connected to the latent power of Runeterra, Ahri is a vastaya who can reshape magic into orbs of raw energy. She revels in toying with her prey by manipulating their emotions before devouring their life essence. Despite her predatory nature...

items.title: The Items Schema
examples: Use Charm to set up your combos, it will make landing Orb of Deception and Fox-Fire dramatically easier.
Initiate team fights using Charm, and chase down stragglers with Spirit Rush.
Spirit Rush enables Ahri's abilities, it opens up paths for Charm, helps double hitting with Orb of Deception, and closes to make use of Fox-Fire.

items.title: The Items Schema
examples: Ahri's survivability is dramatically reduced when her Ultimate, Spirit Rush, is down.
Stay behind minions to make Charm difficult to land, this will reduce Ahri's damage potential significantly.

description.title: The Description Schema
examples: Ahri sends out and pulls back her orb, dealing magic damage on the way out and true damage on the way back. After earning several spell hits, Ahri's next orb hits will restore her health.

tooltip.title: The Tooltip Schema
examples:
Deals {{ e1 }} (+{{ a1 }}) magic damage on the way out, and {{ e1 }} (+{{ a1 }}) true damage on the way back.

Ahri's abilities generate Essence Theft stacks when they hit enemies (max {{ f4.0 }} per cast). At {{ f3.0 }} stacks, Ahri's next Orb of Deception that lands a hit will restore {{ f1.0 }} (+{{ f2.-1 }}) health for each enemy hit.

description.title: The Description Schema
examples: Whenever Ahri's spells hit a champion 2 times within a short period, she briefly gains movement speed.

description.title: The Description Schema
examples: {{sbc|Innate:}} Whenever '''Ahri''' lands 2 ability hits against a champion within {{fd|1.5}} seconds, she gains {{sti|ms|{{as|20% '''bonus''' movement speed}}}} for 3 seconds.

blurb.title: The Blurb Schema
examples: Ahri sends out and pulls back her orb, dealing magic damage on the way out and true damage on the way back. Ahri gains movement speed that decays while her orb is traveling.

description.title: The Description Schema
examples: {{sbc|Passive:}} Whenever '''Ahri''' hits an enemy with one of her abilities, she gains a charge of ''Essence Theft'', and can gain up to 3 charges per ability cast. Upon reaching 9 charges, her next ''Orb of Deception'' {{tip|heals}} her for {{sti|health|{{pp|4|3;5;9;18|1 to 16|color=health}} {{as|(+ 9% AP)}}}} every time an enemy is hit.

description2.title: The Description2 Schema
examples: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Ahri''' sends an orb of arcane energy in the target direction, dealing {{tip|magic damage|{{as|magic damage}}}} to all enemies it passes through, then pulls it back, dealing {{tip|true damage|{{as|true damage}}}} instead.

leveling2.title: The Leveling2 Schema
examples: {{st|Damage Per Pass|{{ap|40 to 140}} {{as|(+ 35% AP)}}|Total Mixed Damage|{{ap|40*2 to 140*2}} {{as|(+ 70% AP)}}}}

notes.title: The Notes Schema
examples:
* ''Orb of Deception'' functions normally during flight regardless of '''Ahri's''' condition.
* Each pass of the projectile can only damage an enemy once.
* If '''Ahri''' is performing an attack animation when the orb switches direction, the attack animation is canceled.
* {{si|Flash}} can be cast during the cast animation of ''Orb of Deception''. If done so, the ability resolves after {{si|Flash}} from the location '''Ahri''' flashed to.
* {{tip|Spell shield}} will block only a single instance of damage.

blurb.title: The Blurb Schema
examples: Ahri blows a kiss that damages and charms an enemy it encounters, causing them to walk harmlessly towards her.

description.title: The Description Schema
examples: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Ahri''' blows a kiss in the target direction that deals {{as|magic damage}} to the first enemy hit, interrupting in-progress dashes, {{tip|charm|charming}} and {{tip|slow|slowing}} them by 65%.

description2.title: The Description2 Schema
examples: An enemy hit by ''Charm'' is vulnerable for 3 seconds, taking 20% '''bonus''' damage from '''Ahri's''' abilities.

notes.title: The Notes Schema
examples:
* The damage amplification also affects the true damage portion of {{ai|Orb of Deception|Ahri}}.
* If the charmed enemy does not have sight of '''Ahri''' they will stand still for its duration.
* The effect ends if '''Ahri''' dies.
* {{si|Flash}} can be cast during the cast animation of ''Charm''.

blurb.title: The Blurb Schema
examples: Ahri dashes forward and fires essence bolts, damaging 3 nearby enemies (prioritizes Champions). Spirit Rush can be cast up to three times before going on cooldown.

description.title: The Description Schema
examples: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Ahri''' {{tip|dashes}} in the target direction, and then fires energy bolts up to 3 visible targets to deal {{as|magic damage}}.

description2.title: The Description2 Schema
examples: ''Spirit Rush'' can be recast twice more at a 1 second {{tt|static cooldown|unaffected by cooldown reduction}} within 10 seconds of activation at no additional cost.

leveling2.title: The Leveling2 Schema
examples: {{st|Maximum single target damage|{{ap|180|270|360}} {{as|(+ 105% AP)}}|Maximum damage|{{ap|540|810|1080}} {{as|(+ 315% AP)}}}}

notes.title: The Notes Schema
examples:
* Each dash counts as another ability instance for the purposes of effects such as {{nie|Spellblade}} and {{ai|Force Pulse|Kassadin}}.
* ''Spirit Rush'' uses [[quick cast]] by default.
* '''Ahri''' must have sight of an enemy in order for ''Spirit Rush'' to target them. Once targeted, the bolts will chase its target even if '''Ahri''' loses sight of them.
** Even if '''Ahri''' gets vision of the fog of war after dashing, it's possible that ''Spirit Rush'' will not target any enemy.
* If '''Ahri''' dies mid-dash, she will not fire the bolts.
